newsitem.title: LITHUANIA: LITHUANIA- HERMIS CONFIRMS EYES BIGGER SIAULIU STAKE.
newsitem.headline: LITHUANIA- HERMIS CONFIRMS EYES BIGGER SIAULIU STAKE.

text.p: Lithuania's second largest private bank, Hermis Bank, confirmed on Tuesday that it was seeking to raise its stake in Siauliu Bank but declined to say by how much.

"We have applied for central bank approval to acquire more than ten percent of the shares in Siauliu Bank but it is premature to say exactly how much," Hermis Bank's deputy chairman Vytautas Jurna told Reuters.
Hermis already has a stake of less than ten percent in Siauliu Bank, which is one of the smallest commercial banks operating in Lithuania.
Sources in the central bank told Reuters that Hermis Bank was eyeing a 51 percent stake in Siauliu Bank.
"We are considering the possibility of buying into Siauliu Bank's next share issue of 14 million litas," Jurna said.
He also said that Hermis was considering buying Siauliu shares on the Vilnius bourse.
Siauliu Bank had a profit of 3.9 million litas in 1996 after reporting losses of 2.9 million litas the previous year.
The bank raised its share capital last December to 20 million litas from 12 million litas and its assets at the end of January were worth 75.3 million litas.
